content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey guys DM Scotty here good to have you
with me today I'm going to show you this Manticore I made for my table I think
he's really neat I took some bits assembled them together
and did some sculpting on it and I came out with a really cool giant Manticore
so let's go the table I'll talk about I made that so here you can see I have my
starting materials now I got a plastic lion and I cut the tail off then I
replaced the tail with a twisted wire tail and I used a fairly thick gauge
wire drilled a hole in the back where the tail was and then attached it with
the goop glue you can also see on the sides I have pegs so those are just the
wires snipped into into short segments and then insert it into the body I used
a dremel tool to drill into the body and I glued those pegs on there and then
drilled some holes in the wing so that they will it'll help them stay on the
body now also the wings are from I dragons toy DreamWorks dragons toy that
I got at the store and I just cut those off the model the toy itself with a
dremel tool and they're ready to go here I have attached the wings with the goop
so I've put them over slid them over the pigs and attach them with goop and you
can see here that I have them sitting up on my workbench drying ready for the
next step now this shows this first picture shows that I have started to
cover the lion with a material called epoxy sculpt and that's a two-part
medium epoxy medium that you mix in equal parts together
and you get a rock-hard result after it dries so after about a day it'll be
rock-hard so it's really great for doing this kind of stuff it's also has the
properties of being very sticky so it sticks to this type of stuff very easily
so you can see I've done the face and I was trying to make it you know more like
a human-like face as manticores have you know more human features but be s'tel
and for the eyes I just use small beads and that makes it really easy that way
you don't have to try to sculpt the eyes you can just push those beads in if your
model is big enough like this you can just push the beads in and then sculpt
around it and you just make some great eyes so there we go I've got the face
and I'm not gonna do all the details yet because it's it's hard to do everything
without messing up what you've already done so I'm doing it in stages so here
you can see this from the side here I've started to cover up the edge where the
wing connects to the body I put some musculature on the front leg and I added
some I enhance the claws on the front legs as we move on you can see that I
did the scorpion tail on the back covered up the white totally covered up
the wire and then I use some toothpicks to make the vicious spines on the end of
the tail so and now we'll move to the next phase now that my previous sculpt
is completely dry you can see here I've added a quite a bit to it
I added some spines coming out of the main of the manticore and to do that I
just drilled some holes into the main of the toy and then slid some toothpicks in
there and glued them with the goop glue you can also see I extended the mane and
it totally blends it with the main of the toy and I made a larger I also added
some vicious-looking fangs I really like those there's just toothpicks
I made the space for those when I sculpted those and
and they really look like a sabertooth appearance I really like that I also
added some spines on the top of the eyes I had done some holes in the sculpt when
I did it I'm not sure if you've seen that in the previous picture but then I
did these just rolled out these small spines from the epoxy sculpt and let him
dry and then glued them on with the goop so there we go that gave a pretty
vicious face looking there and as we move around to the side you can see I've
added some more to the body some more musculature to the body
I also here I've added to the wings I wanted to cover up the wings connecting
with the body but I also wanted to make it look like kind of matched the tail so
it would kind of give it a you know a similar appearance and that's it that's
that's all for the sculpting now I just moved on to painting the creature and
I'm going to show you what it looks like painted so hey guys here's my awesome
Manticore all painted up and you can see some of those details that I did
I'll give you kind of a 360 see some of those details I had it all painted up
but it came out really badass you get a closer look here so here's the face
giant fangs menacing red eyes muscular body vicious tail here we go so I came
out really really neat I thought this uh for just throwing this guy together he's
really cool I'm now here I want to show you a regular Manticore to show scale
comparison so look at that that is a male Manticore and look how big this guy
is to him so pretty cool let me pop a couple of adventures in there just you
can get a scale idea there's a little poor little wizard the manticore is bad
enough but then that giant Manticore is just crazy so there we go that's a
Manticore I made for my game and see you next time
craft now my wife always says I make everything to look like me and you'll
have to see if you agree hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this episode of the
DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other videos as you can see
I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap
terrain for the table if all this intrigues you make sure you check out
all the videos below also join my forum we have lots of great crafters on there
who give advice I have a link above and below and last but not least remember go
forth and craft you
